body: (These lines are quoted from the Architrenius, l. iv. c. 8, a poetical work of John de Hauteville, or Hanville, a monk of St. AlbanÕs, about the year 1190. See WartonÕs History of English Poetry, vol. i. dissert. ii.) Yet such _thefts_ might be less pernicious to mankind than the theological disputes of the Sorbonne, which have been since agitated on the same ground. Bonamy, MŽm. de lÕAcadŽmie, tom. xv. p. 678-632]
